name: VIDEO: Supporting Seniors Through the Shallow Rental Subsidy Program
description: The County is committed to improving the lives of San Diegans who are struggling with housing affordability and the threat of homelessness. One in four people who are experiencing homelessness in San Diego County is over 55 years old, and this population demographic is growing.

affiliation.name: County of San Diego Communications Office

articleContent:
The County is committed to improving the lives of San Diegans who are struggling with housing affordability and the threat of homelessness. One in four people who are experiencing homelessness in San Diego County is over 55 years old, and this population demographic is growing.
An 18-month pilot program approved by the Board of Supervisors has begun helping some low-income older adults, 55 and over, pay rent and improve their housing stability. The Shallow Rental Subsidy Program launched this past spring and more than 2,000 older adults applied. The program will provide $500 monthly in rental assistance to 220 senior households chosen by lottery. For Matthew Pallamary, the extra money has helped him transition from couch surfing to a home of his own.
